Rainforest.Description: Deforestation is a major threat to rainforests worldwide, leading to habitat loss and biodiversity decline.
Rainforests are known for their high levels of biodiversity, hosting a wide variety of plant and animal species.
Many indigenous communities have lived in rainforests for centuries, relying on them for their livelihoods and cultural practices.
Climate change poses risks to rainforests, including increased droughts, wildfires, and shifts in precipitation patterns.
